DataElement.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value Positron Emission Tomography Assessment Mean Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the mean of the measurements of the standard uptake values during a PET assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value Positron Emission Tomography Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to standard uptake value positron emission tomography assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Standard uptake Value Positron Emission Tomography
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly and widely used.:No value exists.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value Positron Emission Tomography Assessment Mean Measurement
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the measurement of the standard uptake value during a PET assessment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
